CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection rejected (incompatibility);Questions of procedure rejected
TEXT: The purpose of the ORG 's Request - to which is appended the ORG drawn up by the Commission in accordance with the provisions of LAW article CARDINAL ) of the Convention - is to submit the case of ORG to the ORG so that it may decide whether or not the facts of the case disclose that ORG has failed in its obligations under LAW .

As appears from ORG Request and from its FAC , Mr. PERSON alleges in his ORG that there has been a violation of the LAW in his case , by the authorities of GPE , inasmuch as he was detained without trial , DATE and CARDINALth DATE , in a military detention camp situated in the territory of GPE , in pursuance of an Order made by the Minister of ORG under LAW against LAW , DATE . The special powers of arrest and of detention allowed to ORG by this LAW are said to have been brought into force on DATE , by a proclamation made and published by ORG on DATE .

After being declared admissible on DATE , the Request was dealt with by the ORG according to the procedure laid down in LAW and CARDINAL ( article DATE , article CARDINAL ) of the Convention . It proved impossible to secure a friendly settlement , and the Commission therefore drew up the ORG called for by LAW article CARDINAL ) of the LAW . This ORG was adopted by the Commission on DATE , the majority holding that there had been no breach of the Convention on the part of ORG and that no action should be taken on the PERSON 's suit for damages .

After transmitting this ORG to ORG DATE , in accordance with LAW , paragraph CARDINAL ( article CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) , of the Convention , the Commission decided at its meeting of DATE , to avail itself of the possibility offered by ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL ( article DATE , article CARDINAL ) of the LAW , and refer the PERSON case to ORG for final decision .

In support of this step , the Commission recalled in its ORG that an opinion stated by it under LAW article CARDINAL ) of the LAW as to whether or not the facts found disclosed a breach of the LAW would not be conclusive . The ORG pointed out that under LAW , paragraph CARDINAL ( article CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) , of the Convention , if a question were not referred to the ORG , it rested with ORG to decide , by a majority of CARDINAL , whether or not there had been a violation of the Convention .

In view of the fundamental importance of the legal problems raised in this case - and particularly of the questions arising in relation to LAW ) of ORG deemed it advisable to refer the case to the ORG , though without qualifying in any way its own opinion on the subject as expressed in the ORG .

At the meeting held on DATE , in accordance with LAW , paragraph CARDINAL , of ORG , and in its Memorial of DATE , the ORG stated that , in conformity with Rule CARDINAL of its Rules of Procedure , it had , on CARDINALth DATE - that is , after referring the case to ORG - transmitted the Report to the Applicant , inviting him to submit his observations to the Commission .
In submitting the ORG to ORG pointed out that that document must be kept secret and that the Applicant was not entitled to publish it .
Rule CARDINAL of the Rules of Procedure of the Commission runs as follows :

" When a case brought before the Commission in pursuance of LAW ) of the LAW is subsequently referred to the ORG , the Secretary of the Commission shall immediately notify the Applicant . Unless the Commission shall otherwise decide , the Secretary shall also in due course communicate to him ORG , informing him that he may , within a time - limit fixed by the President , submit to the ORG his written observations on the said ORG . The ORG shall decide what action , if any , shall be taken in respect of these observations . "

In its ORG declared its readiness " to submit to ORG comments upon the ORG as a document relevant in the present proceedings " . However , instead of communicating these comments on its own initiative , the ORG thought appropriate , at this preliminary stage of the procedure , to request the ORG for leave to file the memorandum containing the PERSON 's comments as a document submitted by ORG .
In the pleadings , the following submissions were made in regard to the procedure alone :
by ORG , in its PERSON :

( CARDINAL ) to give leave for the Commission to submit to ORG comments on ORG as one of the ORG 's documents in the case ; and
( CARDINAL ) in general , to give directions as to the right of the ORG to communicate to the ORG the comments of the Applicant in regard to matters arising in the present proceedings " .
by ORG , in their Counter - Memorial :
" DATE it please the ORG :
( CARDINAL ) to decline jurisdiction in the present case unless the ORG satisfies the ORG that DATE and
DATE , the question of reference of the case to ORG was not discussed in any way by the Commission ;
( CARDINAL ) to refuse to entertain the case while the delay on the part of the Commission in transmitting its ORG to ORG and to the Government has not been satisfactorily explained ;
( CARDINAL ) to declare that any publication by ORG other than that expressly authorised by the Convention , is a breach of the obligations imposed on the Commission by the Convention ;

( CARDINAL ) to rule that the comments of the Applicant on the Report of the Commission and the further comments of the Applicant on matters arising in the present proceedings be not received by the ORG :
( a ) because no argument in favour of their admission has been submitted by ORG , and
